intro: Mimulus bodinieri, commonly known as the golden monkeyflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It features showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Mimulus bodinieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
